txt.en: The Weeping Warrior
You should speak with Queen Regent Erna, who can be found in the Great-keep in Dale.
Talk to the guard on the southern bridge out of Dale and find out if he has seen Bryn.

'It is hard to believe that my brother has forgiven me... or that he ever shall. I even told him about the knife. Now I must do all I can to make it up to him. Ah, what a fool I was! It is bitter, and I am ashamed, but I must hide from unpleasant truths no longer.'
In a huff of anger, Bryn flees
'You have unravelled one more troubling scheme, [placeholder] - one that ran perilously close to my own blood. For that, I thank you.\n\n'And yet... and yet...'

'I am glad to hear that my brother is no longer in danger. It will... take longer to forgive him, but I am sure that I shall. Much like the rebuilding of Dale and of Lake-town. It is hard work, and long, but we know it must be done.'
Talk to the guard on the southern bridge out of Dale.
You should speak with both King Bard II and Prince Bryn, who can be found in the Great-keep in Dale.
Talk to Prince Bryn
The guard is ashamed to have taken money from Bryn
Talk to Erna
Erna is worried about her son Bryn, who has become increasingly distant and sullen.
Talk to King Bard II

'The prince? No, I...'

The guard sighs.

'No, I speak the lie. He did come this way, and paid me not to tell a soul. I was a fool to accept the bribe, and will pay a steeper price, I know. But you must go after the prince, and see that no harm comes to him. That is the greater matter!'
'He crossed the bridge just now. If you hurry, I am sure you will be able to catch up with him.'
You see the guard, but Bryn is nowhere to be seen
TBD
Tell Bryn a <rgb=#FF0000>Story</rgb> of your adventures
Bryn fled to the south in Dale.\n\nLook for a guard on the southern bridge of Dale to see if he has stopped Bryn.
Talk to the southern bridge guard in Dale

Erna draws you near and speaks in a hushed tone.

'I would speak with you of Bryn, [placeholder]. You have seen that he is sullen and distant, but this was not always so. The death of his father and, I doubt not, kingship of his brother have been hard upon the boy.

'Do you recall when I asked you to gather the items for my lecture? I found Bryn where I knew I would find him - outside the walls of Dale. He has gone out much of late, and the danger in doing so is grave. I think, perhaps, that he dreams of the wider world and adventures a young person might have there.

'Would you talk to him of your own adventures? I do not know, yet I hope that may allay some of his restlessness.'
Talk to the southern bridge guard in Dale
Bryn can be found in the Great-keep in Dale.\n\nYou should tell Prince Bryn stories of your adventures.
I am glad to hear that my brother is no longer in danger.
TBD
It is hard to believe that my brother has forgiven me.
The guard is ashamed to have taken money from Bryn
Bryn keeps mainly to himself
Look for a guard on the southern bridge
Talk to Bryn
Seek out the southern bridge guard in Dale
You attempt to tell Bryn a great tale
